 Assailants attacked the Afghan Parliament building with explosives and guns in Kabul city Kabul province Afghanistan This was one of  coordinated attacks in Afghanistan on this day across which  people including  perpetrators were killed and  others wounded The Haqqani Network claimed responsibility for all of the attacks The Haqqani Network clamed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of a larger pattern of violence designed to mark the start of the group spring offensive  Mujahid claimed that the -hour offensive was in revenge for actions by American military forces including the murder of  civilians by a United States US soldier and the burning of Korans at a military base  The spokesperson also claimed the attacks were designed to be a message in direct response to foreign commanders who claimed that the group had lost momentum Casualty numbers represent a division of the total number of those killed across incidents                      and  Complex Attack By Taliban Sends Message To West The New York Times    Explosions   gunfire   shake Afghan capital Associated Press Online    Taliban attacks target NATO Western embassies; Long Planned; Revenge against American troops The Gazette Montreal

 An explosive device targeting an Assam Rifles patrol detonated in Imphal West district Manipur state India Two Assam Rifles personnel were injured in the blast The People Liberation Army India claimed responsibility for the incident stating that the Assam Rifles were targeted because they did not heed a call to strike and suspend all activities in the region A seven-member coordination committee CorCom  consisting of the Kangleipak Communist Party Kanglei Yawol Kanna Lup People Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak People Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak Progressive Revolutionary People Front RPF United National Liberation Front UNLF and United People Party of Kangleipak had called for an  hour strike This strike which was given the moniker of National Black Day was meant to protest the annexation of Manipur by India in  These seven organizations believed that the annexation accord was signed without the approval of the people The People Liberation Army PLA speaking on behalf of the Revolutionary People Front RPF claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that Assam Rifles were targeted because they did not heed the call to strike Ningthoujam Ibungo belongs to the United National Liberation Front UNLF and was arrested in connection with the bombing; however the People Liberation Army India claimed responsibility for the attack Insurgent involved in bomb blast in Manipur arrested Press Trust of India    PLA claims responsibility for attack on Assam Rifles personnel Press Trust of India    Two AR personnel injured in bomb attack in Manipur Press Trust of India   
 Assailants set fire to a truck owned by the Jaya Construction company in Dantewada district Chhattisgarh state India The truck was set on fire to attract police officers Once the officers arrived in the area the assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire Four police officers were injured in the attack No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however authorities attributed it to Maoists stating that it could have been in response to an expanding road construction program The specific motive is unknown; however authorities stated that Maoists could have carried out the attack in response to an expanding road construction program Maoists according to authorities feared that the construction of roads would allow the government to encroach on their territories The police officers were identified as Lalit Netam Poshan Bhuarya Trilochan Kashyap and Rajendra Prasad Four Chhattisgarh cops injured in Maoist ambush Indo-Asian News Service
